subject: p13263843
History: Evaluation of the patient with history of frequent pneumonia with cough and sputum production and left-sided chest discomfort. AP and lateral upright chest radiographs were reviewed in comparison to and multiple prior radiographs dating back to, for example. The patient is after right chest surgery, radiation and most likely lobectomy. There is interval gradual progression of left basal opacity, concerning for infectious process that was previously obscured by pleural effusion and currently appears to be gradually progressing. The appearance of the right hemithorax is stable. No new additional abnormalities have been demonstrated. The right PICC line tip is at the level of mid SVC.
Impression: Suspected left lower lobe pneumonia, attention to this area is recommended.
